hints.content:
The mass of the basketball is $\green{587}$ grams.  

The mass of the baseball is $\purpleD{145}$ grams.

We can find how much greater the mass of the basketball is by subtracting the mass of the baseball $(\purpleD{145}\text{ g})$ from the mass of the basketball $(\greenD{587}\text { g})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled 587 grams. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Basketball. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The shorter left part is labeled 145 grams. The longer right part is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the shorter left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Baseball. A curved bracket across the longer right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Difference. !

hints.content: The basketball's mass is $442$ grams greater than the baseball's mass.

question.content:
Irene finds the mass of her basketball is $587$ grams and her baseball is $145$ grams.

**How much greater is the mass of the basketball than the baseball?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] grams
